processes.label: process
processes.empty: There are no processes imported yet
processes.kpiInfo: KPI values are based on certain reports.
processes.ownerInfo: The process owner is responsible for business metrics for the process. You can use the process owner to sort and filter processes.
processes.ownerRemoveWarning: The '{owner}' owner will be removed from the process
processes.createDashboardMessage: There is no dashboard for this process yet. Would you like Optimize to automatically create a dashboard based on a process template for you?
processes.digestInfo: The process digest sends periodic emails with the existing KPI status to the process owner. By default, the digest will be sent every Monday at 9:00 AM (To change the default send time, please contact your administrator).
processes.digestConfigured: Your process digest has been successfully configured. An email has been sent to {name}.

timeGoals.label: Time goals
timeGoals.setDuration: Set a duration goal by setting a percentage of process instances that should take less than a certain duration to complete.
timeGoals.availableGoals: You can use duration goals to track how many instances are fully automated (target duration) or meet your service level agreements (SLAs).
timeGoals.durationDistributionInfo: This chart shows durations for process instances ending in the current month.
timeGoals.instancesThisMonth: Instances ended in the last 30 days
timeGoals.noInstances: No instances occurred in the time range.
timeGoals.resultInfo: This preview displays each goal's status based on its current configuration.

templates.analyzeSharesAsPieChart-description: Analyze shares for count or duration of processes.
templates.analyzeOrExportRawDataFromATable: Analyze or export raw data from a table
templates.analyzeOrExportRawDataFromATable-descrip: Analyze raw data directly in Optimize or export them for Machine Learning Use Cases.
templates.compareProcessesAndVersionsInABarChart: Compare processes and versions in a bar chart
templates.compareProcessesAndVersionsInABarChart-d: Compare processes and process versions in one report. (Select at least two processes)
templates.correlateDurationAndCountInPieChart: Correlate duration and count in a pie chart
templates.correlateDurationAndCountInPieChart-desc: Correlate the duration and count of a process, incidents, user tasks, or flow nodes.
templates.correlateMetricsInLineBarChart: Correlate metrics in a line/bar chart
templates.correlateMetricsInLineBarChart-descripti: Correlate the duration, percentage, and count of a process.
templates.listIncidentsAsTable-description: See table of all incidents by flow node.
templates.locateBottlenecsOnAHitmap-description: Locate duration or count bottlenecks visualized as heatmap for flow nodes.
templates.localeIncidentHotspotsOnAHeatmap: Locate incident hotspots on a heatmap
templates.localeIncidentHotspotsOnAHeatmap-descrip: Locate incident hotspots visualized as heatmap for incidents.
templates.monitorTargetAsKpi-description: Monitor targets for metrics based on duration, percentage, and count of a process. The metric is flagged as KPI.
templates.monitorTargetAsMetric-description: Monitor targets for metrics based on duration, percentage, and count of a process.
templates.monitorTargetsOverTime-description: Monitor targets over time on duration, percentage, and count of a process.

kpiTemplates.automationRate-description: The automation rate measures which percentage of the process is executed without human interaction.
kpiTemplates.automationRate-filter1: Select the end events that indicate a fully automated process
kpiTemplates.automationRate-filter2: Select the timeframe for which to evaluate automation rate
kpiTemplates.throughput-description: The throughput time indicates how long a process on the happy path needs in average to end
kpiTemplates.throughput-filter1: Select the end events that indicate a fully automated process
kpiTemplates.throughput-filter2: Select the timeframe for which to evaluate throughput

templates.productivity-description: Improve the utilization of existing resources to increase the output.
templates.productivity_incomingToday-description: This report counts the number of incoming requests that started a process.
templates.productivity_incomingThisWeek-descriptio: This report counts the number of incoming requests that started a process this week. The report is marked as KPI.
templates.productivity_incomingInLast2Weeks-descri: This report provides an overview of the incoming requests in the last two weeks.
templates.productivity_currentlyInProgress-descrip: This report counts the currently in-work items. The report is marked as KPI.
templates.productivity_maxNumberOfItemsInProgress: Max number of processes in progress per day
templates.productivity_maxNumberOfItemsInProgress-: This report shows the maximum number of items in progress per day.
templates.productivity_finishedYesterday-descripti: This report counts the items finished yesterday.
templates.productivity_finishedThisWeek-descriptio: This report shows the number of finished items this week. The report is marked as KPI.
templates.productivity_finishedInLast2Weeks-descri: This report shows the rate of items finished in the last 2 weeks.
templates.productivity_text1_line1: How many incoming items started a process?
templates.productivity_text1_line3: React early to unexpected load to be able to deliver on defined targets.
templates.productivity_text1_line9: to obtain it as part of the
templates.productivity_text2_line1: How many items are in progress?
templates.productivity_text2_line3: Balance the number of work in progress to the available resources to ensure process stability.
templates.productivity_text2_line5: - Set the planned number of items in progress as the
templates.productivity_text2_line9: to obtain it as part of the
templates.productivity_text3_line3: Ensure continuous flow of items through the system.
templates.productivity_text3_line7: - Flag report as  to obtain it as part of the
templates.productivity_text3_line9: to obtain it as part of the
templates.efficiency-description: Increase the outcome of processes ended as intended.
templates.efficiency_outcomeThisWeek-description: This report counts the items that ended as intended this week already.
templates.efficiency_outcomeLastWeek-description: This report sums up the items processed as intended last week. The report is marked as KPI.
templates.efficiency_unwantedOutcomeThisWeek-descr: This report measures the unwanted outcomes this week.
templates.efficiency_unwantedOutcomeLastWeek-descr: This report shows the unwanted outcome last week. The report is marked as KPI.
templates.efficiency_outcomeInLast4Weeks-descripti: This report provides an overview of the positive outcomes of the last 4 weeks.
templates.efficiency_incidentFreeRateInLast3Months: Incident-free rate in the last 3 months (KPI)
This report measures the rate of processes ending without an incident.
templates.efficiency_incidentsInLast3Months-descri: This report lists all incidents that occurred in the last 3 months.
templates.efficiency_nodesCausingIncidentsInLast3M: Process nodes causing incidents in the last 3 months
This heatmap show in which process nodes the incidents happened.
templates.efficiency_typesOfUnwantedOutcomeLastWee: Types of unwanted outcome last week
This report shows the types of unwanted outcomes.
templates.efficiency_processScattering: Process scattering from the happy path
templates.efficiency_processScattering-description: This report counts the number of processes that deviate from the happy path.
templates.efficiency_typesOfUnwantedOutcomeLas4tWe: Types of unwanted outcomes in the last 4 weeks
This report shows the types of unwanted outcomes.
templates.efficiency_text1_line3: Understand the most frequent incidents and try to fix them.
templates.efficiency_text2_line1: How many processes ended as intended?
templates.efficiency_text2_line3: Increase wanted and reduce unwanted outcomes.
templates.efficiency_text2_line7: to filter wanted and unwanted process results
templates.efficiency_text3_line3: Reduce the number of processes not on the happy path.
templates.efficiency_text3_line7: to filter wanted and unwanted process result
templates.acceleration-description: Optimize the execution time of tasks in the process and monitor service level agreements for the process.
templates.acceleration_cycleTimeLast7Days-descript: This report shows the average cycle timer of the last 7 days. The report is marked as KPI.
templates.acceleration_cycleTimeLast4Weeks: Cycle time in the last 4 weeks
templates.acceleration_cycleTimeLast4Weeks-descrip: This report shows the average cycle timer of the current month.
templates.acceleration_cycleTimeLastWeeks: Cycle time in the last weeks
templates.acceleration_cycleTimeLastWeeks-descript: This report shows how the cycle time was in the last weeks.
templates.acceleration_deviationOfPlannedToAverage: Deviation of the planned to the average duration
This report shows the planned time for the tasks and the deviation from the plan.
templates.acceleration_durationOfCriticalTasksInLa: Duration of critical tasks in the last month
This table lists all tasks and their average duration.
templates.acceleration_taskBottlenecks-description: This report visualizes the flow nodes that take the most time of the execution.
templates.acceleration_text1_line1: How long does the average process take to end?
templates.acceleration_text1_line3: End processes in the defined target time.
templates.acceleration_text1_line10: filter for wanted and unwanted process results
templates.acceleration_text2_line1: How long did a task take?
templates.acceleration_text2_line3: Reduce process duration by better resource allocation or task optimization.
templates.acceleration_text3_line1: How much longer did a task take than expected?
templates.processDashboard-description: This dashboard provides a competitive overview of metrics and use cases that can be covered with Optimize.
templates.portfolioPerformance-description: View a summary of up to 10 processes
templates.runningTasks: Which user tasks are in progress?
templates.processTotal: How much are we using Camunda?
templates.laborSavings: Are we saving total labor costs?
templates.taskAutomation: How quickly are we automating user tasks?
templates.incidentHandling: Are we resolving incidents fast enough?
templates.taskLifecycle: How long do tasks wait before assignment?

tooltip.zScore: Outliers are calculated based on z-score. Z-score is a statistical measurement that describes a value's relationship to the mean of a group of values. Z-score is measured in terms of standard deviations from the mean.

task.notFound: No outliers found for the selected process
task.onlyCompletedHint: Note: The task analysis is performed on completed flow nodes only
task.info: Heatmap displays the incidence of higher outliers based on duration.

filter.label: Filters

tooltip.instance: Process instance filters return data from process instances matching the filter requirement. If the filter is based on a flow node, the returned data will show all instances where this flow node was triggered.
tooltip.view: Flow node filters return data from flow nodes only, where the flow node or its property matches the filter requirement. Most useful in flow node and user task views.

csvLimit.exportApi: You can also use the data export API to export larger amounts of data from Optimize.

apiErrors.conflict: Could not apply the changes due to conflicts.
apiErrors.reportConflict: Could not apply the report changes due to conflicts.
apiErrors.collectionConflict: Could not apply the collection changes due to conflicts.
apiErrors.invalidDashboardVariableFilter: Could not save the dashboard because one or more variable filters are not valid anymore. Reports may have been changed since the variable filter was added.
apiErrors.sharingNotAllowed: Could not share as this functionality is currently disabled.
apiErrors.reportsNotCombinable: It is not possible to combine the selected reports.
apiErrors.forbiddenError: You are not authorized to perform the requested action.
apiErrors.notAuthorizedError: Could not authenticate you, please check your credentials.
apiErrors.notFoundError: The server could not find the requested resource.
apiErrors.badRequestError: The server was unable to process the request.
apiErrors.elasticsearchConnectionError: The server has encountered Elasticsearch connection issues.
apiErrors.nonTenantScopeCompliantConflict: Could not apply action due to conflicts with the collection data source. The definition for the report is available in the data source yet at least one tenant defined in the report is not available in the data source.
apiErrors.nonDefinitionScopeCompliantConflict: Could not apply action due to conflicts with the collection data source. The report definition is not defined in the data source.
apiErrors.invalidEventProcessState: This operation is cannot be performed in the current state of the event-based process.
apiErrors.userOrGroupIdNotFound: The provided user or group ID does not exist in Optimize.
apiErrors.tooManyBuckets: Could not evaluate report because the result has more than 10.000 data points. Please add filters or adjust the bucket size to reduce the size of the report result.
apiErrors.elasticsearchError: Elasticsearch encountered an error. If this issue persists, please contact your administrator.
apiErrors.importDefinitionDoesNotExist: Import failed because the imported entity requires definitions that don't exist.
apiErrors.importIndexVersionMismatch: Import failed because the data structure of the imported entities do not match the current data structure. Please migrate the data in your source Optimize before exporting to ensure the Optimize Version matches.
apiErrors.importDefinitionForbidden: Import failed because you are not authorized to access some of the required definitions for the imported entity.
apiErrors.importFileInvalid: Import failed because the provided file was invalid. Only JSON files exported from Optimize can be imported.
apiErrors.importDescriptionInvalid: Import failed because the provided description was invalid. Must be null or not greater than 400 characters.
apiErrors.invalidAlertEmailAddresses: Users with the following email addresses are not available for receiving alerts: {invalidAlertEmails}
apiErrors.payloadTooLarge: The request payload is too large.
apiErrors.reportNotSupportedForOpenSearch: This type of report is currently not supported for OpenSearch.

report.instancesCurrentlyInProgressDescription: This report shows how busy your cluster currently is.
report.instancesStartedInLastSixMonthsDescripti: This report provides insight into the overall adoption of process orchestration.
report.instancesEndedInLastSixMonthsDescription: This report shows the total number of automated process instances ended.

instantDashboard.processDashboard-description: This dashboard provides a competitive overview of metrics and use cases that can be covered with Optimize.
instantDashboard.processDashboard_text1_line2: Aggregate and group the process execution data into days, weeks, and months to monitor and report business metrics and key performance indicators (KPI).
instantDashboard.processDashboard_text1_line3: Subscribe to an email digest to obtain a weekly summary of your process metrics and KPIs
instantDashboard.processDashboard_text2_line2: Use all gathered process execution data to investigate problems or kick off new process improvements.
instantDashboard.processDashboard_text2_line3: Use Optimize outlier analysis to find improvement potential in your process
instantDashboard.processDashboard_text3_line1: Monitor process health in near real-time
instantDashboard.processDashboard_text3_line2: See process execution data of the last minutes, hours, and days in near real-time to take corrective actions if needed.
instantDashboard.processDashboard_text3_line3: Create a copy of this dashboard to be able to adjust it to your needs

report.processDashboard_currentlyRunningProcess: This report provides an overview of the progress of all running processes.
report.processDashboard_incomingInLast7Days-des: This report counts the number of incoming requests that started a process.
report.processDashboard_currentlyInProgress-des: This report counts all currently running processes.
report.processDashboard_endedInLast7Days-descri: This report counts all processes that ended in the last 7 days.
report.processDashboard_openIncidents-descripti: This report shows the number of open incidents.
report.processDashboard_currentlyOpenIncidents-: This report shows flow nodes with currently open incidents.
report.processDashboard_processEndedGroupedByMo: This report provides an overview of the utilization of the process in the last months.
report.processDashboard_bottlenecksInTheProcess: Bottlenecks in the process ended in the last 6 months
The heatmap highlights the flow nodes that consume on average the most time to be completed.
report.flownodeDuration: Which process steps take too much time? (To do: Add target values for these process steps)
report.instanceTrends: How frequently is this process run?
report.flownodeFrequency: How often is each process step run?
